title: Photography
text:
As a wizard and scholar of Middle-earth, I have been studying the magic of the natural world for centuries. Through my self-portraits, I aim to capture the essence of my own being and reflect on my own journey through time. Each photograph is a reflection of my own experiences and emotions. Through my photography, I hope to offer a glimpse into my life as a scholar and adventurer, and inspire others to reflect on their own journeys through the world.

title: Publications
text: My research has contributed to advancing our understanding of cardiovascular physiology, with a focus on hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and therapeutic interventions. Below are some of the key publications I have contributed to:

title: Publications
text:
Ongoing Work
In addition to my published work, I am actively involved in collaborative projects that explore:

Innovative biomarkers for cardiovascular diseases.
Preclinical models for testing novel heart failure therapies.
Translational approaches to bridge basic science and clinical applications.

Stay tuned for updates on my latest research contributions.

title: Education and Research
text: I have always been driven by curiosity and a passion for discovery. My journey in cardiovascular research and education reflects a commitment to advancing science and making a meaningful impact in medicine.

title: Education and Research
text:
Education
My academic path has provided me with the foundation to bridge the gap between biotechnology and patient-centered healthcare.
Bachelor of Science in Biotechnology
Kent State University
Equipped with expertise in molecular biology, genetics, and research methodologies.
Master’s in Clinical Epidemiology
Kent State University (Class of 2026)
Pursuing advanced training to combine my research background with Epidemiology.

title: Education and Research
text:
Research
Through my work as a research assistant at Case Western Reserve University, I explored the molecular underpinnings of cardiovascular disease, with a particular focus on hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. Using advanced techniques like echocardiography, telemetry, and histology, I contributed to uncovering how N-terminal truncated cardiac myosin-binding protein C (cMyBPC) affects heart function.

Key Contributions:

Conducted preclinical studies to explore therapeutic approaches for cardiac dysfunction.
Advanced gene delivery techniques, including AAV9-mediated therapy, to restore cardiac function.
Investigated hypertrophic cardiomyopathy using murine models, uncovering insights that bridge molecular research and clinical applications.

title: Projects
text:
arXiv Preprint | Code
Over the centuries, I have devoted countless hours to deciphering and translating the ancient scripts and dialects of the various peoples of Middle-earth. My goal is to gain a deeper understanding of the cultures and histories of these peoples by studying their languages. Currently, I am working on a monograph that explores the linguistic roots of the Elvish languages. Through extensive research and analysis, I hope to shed light on the connections between the different dialects of Elvish and their origins. This project has been particularly challenging, as Elvish is a complex and nuanced language, but I am determined to see it through to completion.

title: Projects
section: The History of the War of the Ring
text:
The History of the War of the Ring

arXiv Preprint | Code
I am creating a comprehensive and detailed history of the conflict that goes beyond the surface-level events. By gathering information from a variety of sources, including my own memories, written accounts, and oral histories, I hope to shed new light on this important period in Middle-earth’s history and provide valuable insights into the motivations and actions of the various players involved.

title: Welcome to my website!
text:

Welcome to my website!
I am Mandeep Singh, a passionate researcher and lifelong learner currently working in the field of cardiovascular physiology. With a background in biotechnology and a commitment to advancing medicine, I strive to contribute to meaningful research that helps improve lives and promotes better health. My work focuses on understanding the intricate mechanisms of the cardiovascular system, with the goal of translating insights into practical solutions for patients and healthcare. I enjoy exploring innovative methods to tackle complex problems, fostering collaboration, and mentoring others to ignite a shared passion for science. On this website, you’ll find information about my research, projects, and publications, as well as resources for those interested in science, medicine, and innovation. I believe in making science accessible and engaging, and I’m excited to share my journey with you. Feel free to explore the site, connect with me, and learn more about my work. If you’d like to collaborate or just have a conversation, don’t hesitate to reach out.
